intro: Seymeria stricta, commonly known as the rigid seymeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright, sturdy stems that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seymeria stricta is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained, loamy soils.
